.method familyhidebysig instance string DeterminePostBack(string target) cil managed

Docs.param: The target.
Docs.summary: Determines whether the given target requires a postback and returns the required postback argument. Returns if the target is an external link. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.returns: The required postback argument for the specified target. If no postback argument is required, this method returns .

MemberSignature.Value: protected void ExitSecondaryUIMode ();
.method familyhidebysig instance void ExitSecondaryUIMode() cil managed

Docs.summary: Exits any secondary user interface (UI) mode for the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is equivalent to setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlControlAdapter.SecondaryUIMode%2A> property to <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlControlAdapter.NotSecondaryUI>.

MemberSignature.Value: protected static readonly int NotSecondaryUI;
.field family static initonly int32 NotSecondaryUI

Docs.summary: Returns a constant that defines a mode where no secondary user interface (UI) is displayed. This field is read-only. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The HTML and WML adapter sets support a concept called *secondary UI*. Secondary UI is used by controls that need to show additional screens of UI, in the same way that a Windows-based application shows dialog boxes. For more information about secondary user interfaces, see the [Adapter Sets Functionality](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/903adf84-e45c-407e-8b55-98796c084ff7) documentation.

Docs.param: The text writer.
The specified target (form or URL).
Text used for the softkey.

Set to if the softkey label comes from the adapter itself (the default label, or something else that is adapter specified, such as "Call" for a , rather than a softkey label explicitly specified by the application author.
Determines whether a softkey label is used for the link. If , the softkeyLabel text is used.
Docs.summary: Renders the opening tag of a link. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method automatically checks for the type of link and renders the appropriate markup language. The specified target can refer to another URL or to a form on the same page.

MemberSignature.Value: protected void RenderLink (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter writer, string targetUrl, string softkeyLabel, bool implicitSoftkeyLabel, bool mapToSoftkey, string text, bool breakAfter);

.method familyhidebysig instance void RenderLink(class System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter writer, string targetUrl, string softkeyLabel, bool implicitSoftkeyLabel, bool mapToSoftkey, string text, bool breakAfter) cil managed

Docs.param: The specified text writer.
The URL target.
The softkey text to use for the link.
Set to if mapping to a softkey on the device.

Set to if the softkey label comes from the device adapter itself (the default label, or something else that is adapter specified, such as "Call" for a PhoneCall control), rather than a softkey label explicitly specified by the application author.
The text defining the link.
Set to if the BreakAfter property is required to be set.
Docs.summary: Renders an entire link, with the specified text inside. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the `mapToSoftKey` parameter is set to `true`, the text of the `softkeyLabel` parameter is displayed.

Set to if mapping to a softkey on the device.
Text defining the link.
Set to if a break element is added after the text field.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the `mapToSoftKey` parameter is set to `true`, the text of the `softkeyLabel` parameter is displayed.

MemberSignature.Value: protected void RenderPostBackEvent (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter writer, string argument, string softkeyLabel, bool mapToSoftkey, string text, bool breakAfter, System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlPostFieldType postBackType);

.method familyhidebysig instance void RenderPostBackEvent(class System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter writer, string argument, string softkeyLabel, bool mapToSoftkey, string text, bool breakAfter, valuetype System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlPostFieldType postBackType) cil managed

Docs.param: The specified text writer.
The argument for the action. The argument is included in the postback generated when the user selects the action.
The softkey text.
Set to if mapping to a softkey on the device.
Text defining the link.
Set to if a break element is added after the text field.
Specifies how the postfield is written.
Docs.summary: Renders a postback event with the control as a target. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This overload sets the default value for the postback type to <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlPostFieldType.Normal>. If the `mapToSoftKey` parameter is set to `true`, the text of the `softkeyLabel` parameter is displayed. The following table shows the postback types used for the `postBackType` argument.
|Type|Description| |----------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlPostFieldType.Normal>|The postback contains a name and an encoded argument.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlPostFieldType.Submit>|The postback contains the control used to submit the form, typically an _EVENTTARGET and a command.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlPostFieldType.Variable>|The postback contains a name and a variable reference.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlPostFieldType.Raw>|The postback contains a name and an argument.|

MemberSignature.Value: protected void RenderSubmitEvent (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter writer, string softkeyLabel, string text, bool breakAfter);
.method familyhidebysig instance void RenderSubmitEvent(class System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter writer, string softkeyLabel, string text, bool breakAfter) cil managed

Docs.param: Specifies the output stream.
Contains the text label for the softkey.
Text defining the link.
Contains if a break element is to be added after the control.
Docs.summary: Renders a form submission event appropriate for the device. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

MemberSignature.Value: protected int SecondaryUIMode { get; set; }
.property instance int32 SecondaryUIMode

Docs.summary: Sets or returns the secondary user interface (UI) mode for the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The secondary UI mode for the control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The HTML and WML adapter sets support a concept called *secondary UI*. Secondary UI is used by controls that need to show additional screens of UI, in the same way as a dialog box in a Windows-based application. For more information about secondary user interfaces, see [Adapter Sets Functionality](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/903adf84-e45c-407e-8b55-98796c084ff7).
